author: cnbc.com
title: BRIEF-Zuckerberg tells CNN he is 'sorry' for 'breach of trust'
text:
March 21 (Reuters) - Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg spoke on Wednesday to broadcaster CNN and tech news website Recode.
* CEO MARK ZUCKERBERG TELLS WEBSITE RECODE HE IS "OPEN" TO TESTIFYING BEFORE U.S. CONGRESS
* ZUCKERBERG TELLS CNN IN SEPARATE INTERVIEW HE IS "SORRY" FOR "BREACH OF TRUST"
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK SHOULD NOT HAVE TRUSTED CAMBRIDGE ANALYTICA IN 2015 WHEN IT SAID IT WOULD DELETE FACEBOOK DATA
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK'S AUDIT OF DATA PRIOR TO 2014 WILL REVIEW THOUSANDS OF THIRD-PARTY APPS
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS HE IS "SURE SOMEONE'S TRYING" TO MEDDLE IN ELECTIONS VIA FACEBOOK NOW
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS FACEBOOK IS COMMITTED TO STOPPING INTERFERENCE IN ELECTIONS INCLUDING IN INDIA, BRAZIL
* ZUCKERBERG SAYS "I'M NOT SURE WE SHOULDN'T BE REGULATED," SAYS HE FAVORS "RIGHT REGULATION" Further company coverage:
(Reporting By David Ingram)
